page.title: 05GROWING UP IN BEMPTON
page.content: {Education} is at the forefront for the younger villagers starting with the pre-school playgroup which meet twice a week. The next step is the village {Primary School}which has recently been extended. At present 63 children are catered for between the ages of 4+ to 11 years. Unlike many village schools the number of pupils has increased during the past few years, due in part to the various { {housing developments}taking place. Children of secondary school age, i.e. 11+ to 16 (or 18 in the case of sixth formers) travel into { {Bridlington}to one of the two comprehensives. From there some may go on to the{East Yorkshire}College of Further Education or some other educational establishment. Others will join the quest for employment.
